page.content: The 'works' has recentlu gone into startling decline. In December 1984, Adamson Butterley, announced the redundancy of the 350 workers employed at their Horsehay plant. AB Cranes Ltd, were making cranes for steelworks, for use on off-shore oil rigs, and natural gas pipelines. They had become exporters to South America, Australia and New Zealand, India and China. 90% of their employees came from within an 8 mile radius. The average age of the workers was between 35-38 years: with 322 men and 22 women. Skillled workers were earning an average of Â£122 per week and semi- skilled an average of Â£116 per week.By the end of March 1985, all but 30 of them were redundant.
